classes.name: JOptionPane
classes.description: Provides standard dialog boxes for displaying messages, getting user input, and confirming actions. Commonly used in Ignition Vision client scripts.

constructors.description: Creates a JOptionPane with a test message.
Creates a JOptionPane to display the specified message.
Creates a JOptionPane to display the specified message with the specified type.

methods.name: showMessageDialog

params.name: parentComponent
params.description: The parent component for the dialog, or null

methods.description: Displays an information-message dialog titled 'Message'.

methods.name: showMessageDialog

params.name: parentComponent
params.description: The parent component for the dialog, or null

params.name: title
params.description: The title string for the dialog

params.name: messageType
params.description: The type of message (e.g., ERROR_MESSAGE, WARNING_MESSAGE)

methods.description: Displays a message dialog with a specified title and message type.

methods.name: showConfirmDialog

params.name: parentComponent
params.description: The parent component for the dialog, or null

returns.description: YES_OPTION, NO_OPTION, CANCEL_OPTION, or CLOSED_OPTION

methods.description: Displays a dialog with Yes, No, and Cancel options.

methods.name: showConfirmDialog

params.name: parentComponent
params.description: The parent component for the dialog, or null

params.name: title
params.description: The title string for the dialog

returns.description: The option selected by the user

methods.description: Displays a confirmation dialog with the specified title and option type.

methods.name: showConfirmDialog

params.name: parentComponent
params.description: The parent component for the dialog, or null

params.name: title
params.description: The title string for the dialog

returns.description: The option selected by the user

methods.description: Displays a confirmation dialog with the specified title, option type, and message type.

methods.name: showInputDialog

returns.description: User's input, or null if cancelled

methods.description: Shows a question-message dialog requesting input from the user.

methods.name: showInputDialog

params.name: parentComponent
params.description: The parent component for the dialog, or null

returns.description: User's input, or null if cancelled

methods.description: Shows a question-message dialog requesting input from the user, parented to the specified component.

methods.name: showInputDialog

params.name: parentComponent
params.description: The parent component for the dialog, or null

params.name: title
params.description: The title string for the dialog

returns.description: User's input, or null if cancelled

methods.description: Shows a dialog requesting input from the user with a specified title and message type.

methods.name: showOptionDialog
methods.signature: showOptionDialog(parentComponent, message, title, optionType, messageType, icon, options, initialValue)

params.name: parentComponent
params.description: The parent component for the dialog, or null

params.name: title
params.description: The title string for the dialog

params.name: icon
params.description: The icon to display, or null

params.name: options
params.description: Array of objects for the buttons, or null for default

returns.description: The index of the chosen option, or CLOSED_OPTION if closed

methods.description: Displays a fully customizable dialog with a specified icon, button labels, and initial selection.

fields.name: YES_OPTION
fields.description: Return value (0) when the user selects Yes.

fields.name: NO_OPTION
fields.description: Return value (1) when the user selects No.

fields.name: CANCEL_OPTION
fields.description: Return value (2) when the user selects Cancel.

fields.name: OK_OPTION
fields.description: Return value (0) when the user selects OK.

fields.name: CLOSED_OPTION
fields.description: Return value (-1) when the user closes the dialog without choosing.

fields.name: YES_NO_OPTION
fields.description: Option type for dialogs with Yes and No buttons.

fields.name: YES_NO_CANCEL_OPTION
fields.description: Option type for dialogs with Yes, No, and Cancel buttons.

fields.name: OK_CANCEL_OPTION
fields.description: Option type for dialogs with OK and Cancel buttons.

fields.name: DEFAULT_OPTION
fields.description: Option type meaning the dialog has no preset button configuration.

fields.name: ERROR_MESSAGE
fields.description: Message type for error messages.

fields.name: INFORMATION_MESSAGE
fields.description: Message type for informational messages.

fields.name: WARNING_MESSAGE
fields.description: Message type for warning messages.

fields.name: QUESTION_MESSAGE
fields.description: Message type for questions.

fields.name: PLAIN_MESSAGE
fields.description: Message type meaning no icon is used.

classes.name: JTable
classes.description: Displays and edits regular two-dimensional tables of cells. Used in Ignition Vision for data display components.

constructors.description: Constructs a default JTable initialized with a default data model, column model, and selection model.
Constructs a JTable to display the values in the two-dimensional array.

params.name: dm
params.description: The data model for the table

constructors.description: Constructs a JTable initialized with the given data model.
Constructs a JTable with the given number of rows and columns of empty cells.

methods.name: getValueAt

returns.description: The value at the specified cell

methods.description: Returns the cell value at the given row and column.

methods.name: setValueAt
methods.description: Sets the value for the cell at the given row and column.

methods.name: getRowCount

returns.description: The number of rows

methods.description: Returns the number of rows in the table.

methods.name: getColumnCount

returns.description: The number of columns

methods.description: Returns the number of columns in the column model.

methods.name: getColumnName

returns.description: The name of the column

methods.description: Returns the name of the column at the given index.

methods.name: getSelectedRow

returns.description: The index of the first selected row, or -1

methods.description: Returns the index of the first selected row, -1 if no row is selected.

methods.name: getSelectedRows

returns.description: An array of selected row indices

methods.description: Returns the indices of all selected rows.

methods.name: getSelectedColumn

returns.description: The index of the first selected column, or -1

methods.description: Returns the index of the first selected column, -1 if no column is selected.

methods.name: getModel

returns.description: The TableModel that provides the data

methods.description: Returns the TableModel that provides the data displayed by this JTable.

methods.name: setModel

params.name: dataModel
params.description: The new data source for the table

methods.description: Sets the data model for this table.

methods.name: clearSelection
methods.description: Deselects all selected columns and rows.

methods.name: setRowSelectionInterval

params.name: index1
params.description: The other end of the interval

methods.description: Selects the rows from index0 to index1, inclusive.

methods.name: getRowHeight

returns.description: The height in pixels of each row

methods.description: Returns the height of a table row, in pixels.

methods.name: setRowHeight
methods.description: Sets the height, in pixels, of all cells to rowHeight.

methods.name: setAutoResizeMode
methods.description: Sets the table's auto resize mode when the table is resized.

fields.name: AUTO_RESIZE_OFF
fields.description: Do not adjust column widths automatically.

fields.name: AUTO_RESIZE_ALL_COLUMNS
fields.description: Proportionally resize all columns when the table is resized.

fields.name: AUTO_RESIZE_LAST_COLUMN
fields.description: Adjust only the last column during resize.

fields.name: AUTO_RESIZE_NEXT_COLUMN
fields.description: Adjust only the next column during resize.

fields.name: AUTO_RESIZE_SUBSEQUENT_COLUMNS
fields.description: Adjust subsequent columns equally during resize (default).

classes.name: JPanel
classes.description: A generic lightweight container for grouping components. Uses FlowLayout by default.

constructors.description: Creates a new JPanel with a double buffer and a FlowLayout.
Creates a new JPanel with the specified layout manager.
Creates a new JPanel with FlowLayout and the specified buffering strategy.

methods.name: add

returns.description: The added component

methods.description: Appends the specified component to the end of this container.

methods.name: add
methods.description: Adds the specified component with the specified constraints to the layout.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes the specified component from this container.

methods.name: removeAll
methods.description: Removes all the components from this container.

methods.name: setLayout
methods.description: Sets the layout manager for this container.

methods.name: getLayout

returns.description: The current layout manager

methods.description: Gets the layout manager for this container.

methods.name: setBackground
methods.description: Sets the background color of this component.

methods.name: setBorder

params.name: border
params.description: The border to render for this component

methods.description: Sets the border of this component.

methods.name: setPreferredSize
methods.description: Sets the preferred size of this component.

methods.name: revalidate
methods.description: Supports deferred layout by marking this component as needing to be laid out.

methods.name: repaint
methods.description: Repaints this component.

classes.name: JFrame
classes.description: A top-level window with a title and border. Commonly used as the main application window.

constructors.description: Constructs a new frame that is initially invisible.
Creates a new, initially invisible frame with the specified title.

methods.name: setTitle

params.name: title
params.description: The title to display in the frame's border

methods.description: Sets the title for this frame.

methods.name: getTitle

returns.description: The title of this frame

methods.description: Gets the title of the frame.

methods.name: setSize
methods.description: Resizes this component to the specified width and height.

methods.name: setVisible

params.name: b
params.description: Whether the frame should be visible

methods.description: Shows or hides this frame depending on the value of the parameter.

methods.name: setDefaultCloseOperation
methods.description: Sets the operation that happens when the user closes the frame.

methods.name: setLocationRelativeTo

params.name: c
params.description: The component to center relative to, or null for screen center

methods.description: Sets the location of the window relative to the specified component. Pass null to center on screen.

methods.name: setResizable
methods.description: Sets whether this frame is resizable by the user.

methods.name: getContentPane

returns.description: The content pane of this frame

methods.description: Returns the content pane object for this frame.

methods.name: setContentPane

params.name: contentPane
params.description: The content pane for this frame

methods.description: Sets the content pane for this frame.

methods.name: pack
methods.description: Causes this window to be sized to fit the preferred size of its subcomponents.

methods.name: setJMenuBar

params.name: menubar
params.description: The menu bar for this frame

methods.description: Sets the menu bar for this frame.

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Releases all native screen resources used by this window and its subcomponents.

fields.name: EXIT_ON_CLOSE
fields.description: Exit the application when the frame is closed (value 3).

fields.name: DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE
fields.description: Dispose the frame when it is closed.

fields.name: DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE
fields.description: Do nothing when the frame is closed.

fields.name: HIDE_ON_CLOSE
fields.description: Hide the frame when it is closed (default).

classes.name: JButton
classes.description: An implementation of a push button. Used to trigger actions when clicked.

constructors.description: Creates a button with no text or icon.
Creates a button with the specified text.
Creates a button with the specified icon.
Creates a button with the specified text and icon.

methods.name: setText

params.name: text
params.description: The string used to set the text

methods.description: Sets the button's text.

methods.name: getText

returns.description: The text of the button

methods.description: Returns the button's text.

methods.name: setEnabled

params.name: b
params.description: Whether the button should be enabled

methods.description: Enables or disables the button.

methods.name: isEnabled

returns.description: True if the button is enabled

methods.description: Returns whether the button is enabled.

methods.name: addActionListener
methods.description: Adds an ActionListener to the button.

methods.name: removeActionListener
methods.description: Removes an ActionListener from the button.

methods.name: setIcon

params.name: defaultIcon
params.description: The icon used as the default image

methods.description: Sets the button's default icon.

methods.name: setToolTipText
methods.description: Sets the tooltip text for this button.

methods.name: doClick
methods.description: Programmatically performs a click, triggering all associated ActionListeners.

methods.name: setMnemonic
methods.description: Sets the keyboard mnemonic for this button.

classes.name: JLabel
classes.description: A display area for a short text string, an image, or both. Does not react to input events.

constructors.description: Creates a JLabel with no image and an empty string for the title.
Creates a JLabel with the specified text.
Creates a JLabel with the specified image.

params.name: horizontalAlignment
params.description: One of LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT, LEADING, or TRAILING

constructors.description: Creates a JLabel with the specified text and horizontal alignment.

methods.name: setText

params.name: text
params.description: The single line of text to display

methods.description: Sets the text this label will display. Supports HTML via '<html>' prefix.

methods.name: getText

returns.description: The text displayed by this label

methods.description: Returns the text string that the label displays.

methods.name: setIcon

params.name: icon
params.description: The image to display as the default icon

methods.description: Sets the icon this label will display.

methods.name: getIcon

returns.description: The default icon

methods.description: Returns the graphic image (glyph, icon) that the label displays.

methods.name: setHorizontalAlignment

params.name: alignment
params.description: One of LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT, LEADING, or TRAILING

methods.description: Sets the alignment of the label's contents along the X axis.

methods.name: setVerticalAlignment

params.name: alignment
params.description: One of TOP, CENTER, or BOTTOM

methods.description: Sets the alignment of the label's contents along the Y axis.

methods.name: setFont
methods.description: Sets the font for this component.

methods.name: setForeground
methods.description: Sets the foreground color of this component.

methods.name: setToolTipText
methods.description: Sets the tooltip text for this label.

methods.name: setLabelFor

params.name: c
params.description: The component this label is for

methods.description: Sets the component that this label describes for accessibility purposes.

fields.name: LEFT
fields.description: Left alignment constant (inherited from SwingConstants).

fields.name: CENTER
fields.description: Center alignment constant (inherited from SwingConstants).

fields.name: RIGHT
fields.description: Right alignment constant (inherited from SwingConstants).

fields.name: TOP
fields.description: Top alignment constant (inherited from SwingConstants).

fields.name: BOTTOM
fields.description: Bottom alignment constant (inherited from SwingConstants).

fields.name: LEADING
fields.description: Leading alignment constant for bidi support (inherited from SwingConstants).

fields.name: TRAILING
fields.description: Trailing alignment constant for bidi support (inherited from SwingConstants).
